enchantment.discernment.discernment.desc:
Prevents a living entity (including a player) from damaging any peaceful mob while:
1) The entity is wearing an item as armor, or holding an item in their main or off hand, that has this enchantment on it.
2) The entity is not sneaking.
Configures functionality of the discernment effect/enchantment
Available In Enchanting Table
Specifies whether the discernment enchantment shows up as a possible enchantment in an enchanting table.
Protection
Configures the creative for determining which entities are protected by the discernment effect/enchantment
Blacklist Named Entities
Configures the protection of entities named with a name tag
Enabled
Specifies whether entities named with a name tag will be prevented from being protected by discernment. The Name Regex Pattern/Flags configs determine which names will provide protection.
Name Regex Pattern

Specifies the regular expression pattern that determine which names will provide protection. If an entity's custom name matches the pattern, it will be protected. Simple Examples: (?:) will match characters between the ? and :, so (?:test) will match if a name contains 'test'. Starting with ^ will only match against the start of the name, so ^(?:test) will match the name 'test1' but not '2test1'. Ending with $ will only match against the end of the name, so (?:test)$ will match the name '2test' but not '2test1'. Adding | between elements will match if either matches, so ^(?:test1)|(?:test2) will match the name 'test1_test2_test3' or 'test1_test3_test2' or 'test3_test2' but not 'test1_test3'. As this is only a small fraction of what regular expressions can do, visit regex101.com and select 'Java' for more help. The Name Regex Flags config determines the flags to use with this pattern.
Name Regex Flags

Specifies the flags that determine the matching behavior of the regular expression pattern specified by the Name Regex Pattern config. Possible values are: UNIX_LINES (enables Unix lines mode), CASE_INSENSITIVE (enables case-insensitive matching), COMMENTS (permits whitespace and comments in pattern), MULTILINE (enables multiline mode), LITERAL (enables literal parsing of the pattern), DOTALL (enables dotall mode), UNICODE_CASE (enables Unicode-aware case folding), CANON_EQ (enables canonical equivalence), UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS (enables the Unicode version of Predefined character classes and POSIX character classes). Visit the Filed Detail section at docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html for a more in-depth description of each flag.
Whitelist Named Entities
Configures the protection of entities named with a name tag
Enabled
Specifies whether entities named with a name tag will be protected by discernment. The Name Regex Pattern/Flags configs determine which names will provide protection.
Name Regex Pattern

Specifies the regular expression pattern that determine which names will provide protection. If an entity's custom name matches the pattern, it will be protected. Simple Examples: (?:) will match characters between the ? and :, so (?:test) will match if a name contains 'test'. Starting with ^ will only match against the start of the name, so ^(?:test) will match the name 'test1' but not '2test1'. Ending with $ will only match against the end of the name, so (?:test)$ will match the name '2test' but not '2test1'. Adding | between elements will match if either matches, so ^(?:test1)|(?:test2) will match the name 'test1_test2_test3' or 'test1_test3_test2' or 'test3_test2' but not 'test1_test3'. As this is only a small fraction of what regular expressions can do, visit regex101.com and select 'Java' for more help. The Name Regex Flags config determines the flags to use with this pattern.
Name Regex Flags

Specifies the flags that determine the matching behavior of the regular expression pattern specified by the Name Regex Pattern config. Possible values are: UNIX_LINES (enables Unix lines mode), CASE_INSENSITIVE (enables case-insensitive matching), COMMENTS (permits whitespace and comments in pattern), MULTILINE (enables multiline mode), LITERAL (enables literal parsing of the pattern), DOTALL (enables dotall mode), UNICODE_CASE (enables Unicode-aware case folding), CANON_EQ (enables canonical equivalence), UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS (enables the Unicode version of Predefined character classes and POSIX character classes). Visit the Filed Detail section at docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html for a more in-depth description of each flag.
Protect Peaceful Mobs
Specifies whether peaceful mobs will be protected by discernment.
Protect Players
Specifies whether players will be protected by discernment.
Protect Owned Entities
Specifies whether entities owned by the entity with discernment will be protected.
config.discernment.server.particles.tool: Configures the type and number of spawned particles
config.discernment.server.particles.enab: If set to true, particles will spawn when damage is blocked by the Discernment enchantment. If set to false, none will spawn.
config.discernment.server.particles.name: Names

Spawned particles will be randomly selected from a pool of types defined by this list of registry names. Note that only particle types which extends the ParticleOptions class are allowed. Rare examples of particles that don't do so are ones that require additional data (like a BlockState, in the case of ParticleTypes.FALLING_DUST).
config.discernment.server.particles.coun: Specifies the number of particles spawned when an entity directly attacks another entity. Note that this only applies when the attack is direct, and when a raytrace of the attacker to to target entity is successful. Otherwise, a fixed number of particles are spawned all around the target entity in the normal vanilla manner.
config.discernment.server.sounds.tooltip: Configures the type, volume, and pitch of played sounds
config.discernment.server.sounds.enabled: If set to true, a sound will play when damage is blocked by the Discernment enchantment. If set to false, none will play.
config.discernment.server.sounds.names.t: Played sounds will be randomly selected from a pool of types defined by this list of registry names.
Sounds will play within this volume range.
Specifies the minimum volume that sounds will play at.
Specifies the maximum volume that sounds will play at.
config.discernment.server.sounds.pitch.t: Sounds will play within this pitch range.
config.discernment.server.sounds.pitch.m: Specifies the minimum pitch that sounds will play at.
Specifies the maximum pitch that sounds will play at.
